citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:33 AM on 23-
January-2026. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee by speaking with a store employee and calling the
licensee's phone number. At 11:33 AM the inspector asked a store employee if the licensee was available. The employee
called the licensee and spoke with him at 11:35 AM. The licensee told the employee that he was not available for
inspection and that the employee was not authorized to facilitate the inspection. The inspector called the licensee and left
voice message at 11:38 AM. At 11:49 AM the employee called the licensee twice and an additional message was left by
the inspector with no response. At 12:49 PM the employee was notified of the citation being an attempted inspection
would be designated as a critical. At 12:51 PM a final voicemail was left by the inspector to the licensee stating the
citation would be an attempted designated as a critical and left the facility. Failure to provide access to the facility,
animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in
enforcement action.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(b)  Critical Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
A responsible adult was not available to accompany APHIS Officials during the inspection process at 11:33 AM on 23-
January-2026. The inspector attempted to contact the licensee by speaking with a store employee and calling the 
licensee's phone number. At 11:33 AM the inspector asked a store employee if the licensee was available. The employee 
called the licensee and spoke with him at 11:35 AM. The licensee told the employee that he was not available for 
inspection and that the employee was not authorized to facilitate the inspection. The inspector called the licensee and left 
voice message at 11:38 AM. At 11:49 AM the employee called the licensee twice and an additional message was left by 
the inspector with no response. At 12:49 PM the employee was notified of the citation being an attempted inspection 
would be designated as a critical. At 12:51 PM a final voicemail was left by the inspector to the licensee stating the 
citation would be an attempted designated as a critical and left the facility. Failure to provide access to the facility, 
animals, and records for inspection is a serious violation of the AWA and regulations. Failure to comply may result in 
enforcement action. 
 
 
End Section
